meta.label: ESRI(r) - World geocoder - detailed address
meta.description: Use this recipe to geocode (transform an address to coordinates), if the address is in multiple fields

params.name: column_object_id
params.label: Object_id column:
params.description: Select the column corresponding to a unique ID in your input dataset (object_id is a unique integer identifier for joining later your data) (mandatory)

params.name: column_adress
params.label: Address column:
params.description: The address column in your input dataset (mandatory)

params.name: column_postal
params.label: Postcode column:
params.description: The postcode column in your input dataset

params.name: column_city
params.label: City column:
params.description: The city column in the input dataset (mandatory)

params.name: column_country
params.label: Country column:
params.description: Country column in your input dataset. This will increase the API precision and speed. Supported types: Country name, ISO2, ISO3 (mandatory even if empty)

params.name: category
params.label: Category:
params.description: (Advanced) Indicate a category you want to focus on. Ex: if your input dataset contains only airport, set this parameter with airport

params.name: out_sr
params.label: Out EPSG (Wkid):
params.description: (Advanced) Set a specific EPSG value for X,Y in output. The default value is 4326, which is the standard (mandatory)

params.name: api_throttle
params.label: API call throttle:
params.description: Define the pause in seconds between each Batch (mandatory)

params.name: sample
params.label: Try on a sample per batch:
params.description: 0 means No Limit. This options uses the first N records per batch of your dataset. Try X first line to check the result. (mandatory)

params.name: token_expiration
params.label: Token expiration:
params.description: Define the token expiration in minutes (mandatory)

params.name: batch_size_unit
params.label: batch size:
params.description: Number of simultaneous addresses sent to the API (When increasing this value you may check with the log that all addresses sent are taken into account
